heading: mcdata soars in debut
subheading: shares of mcdata, the software and switch-making subsidiary of emc, more than triple in first day trading.
author: wired staff
text: shares of switches and software company mcdata soared more than 200 percent to 85.56 in the company's nasdaq stock market debut wednesday, up from an offering price of $28 per share. the company sold 12.5 million shares at the $28-per-share price to raise $350 million on tuesday. the estimated price range for the ipo was $24 to $26 per share, boosted from monday's $19 to $21 per share.mcdata (mcdt), based in broomfield, colo., said it plans to use the proceeds for working capital and general corporate purposes, including a repayment of $1.9 million in outstanding debt owed to mcdata holdings, a subsidiary of emc corp. the company's products connect servers and storage systems in networks.the company reported net income of $9.6 million, or 10 cents per share, on $103.6 million in revenues for the six months that ended june 30, 2000, compared with a net loss of $2.0 million, or a loss of 2 cents per share, on $34.2 million in revenues in the year-earlier period.shares of mcdata reached as high as 80 after opening at 73.
